posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I checked the wiki, and Epic Dodge is not on the list of feats that cannot be taken on a Fighter level, so that's not the problem. Are you sure you have ALL the prerequisites? I see that you have the required feats and 25+ DEX by then, but do you have 30 Tumble?

If your opponent has Blind Fight, he gets to make two concealment rolls and only if both rolls fail does the concealment block his attack, which effectively squares the concealment, so 50% becomes 25%, 40% becomes 16%, 30% becomes 9%, 20% becomes 4% and 10% becomes 1%. Because of this, builders usually go for all five Self Concealment feats, or they don't bother.
http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Concealment

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It is actually squared (multiplied by itself).
Let's say you roll an attack roll and beat the AC, you normally score a hit.
If you don't hit because of the concealment, BF gives you another chance to beat the concealment.
If the concealment is 50%, it will stop the attack half of the time and not the other half. So you will miss 50% of the time.
If you miss, you get another chance, and this time you will also miss 50% of the time. But 50 % of 50 % is 25 %, so in total you will only miss 25 % of the time when you reroll a 50 % chance.
The math is: 0.5 x 0.5 = 0.25 = 25%
When the miss chance is 40%, rerolled it becomes 0.4 x 0.4 = 0.16 = 16%
For 30% it is: 0.3 x 0.3 = 0.09 = 9%
For 20% it is: 0.2 x 0.2 = 0.04 = 4%
For 10% it is: 0.1 x 0.1 = 0.01 = 1%

Hope this clarifies some.
